title: Amazon lays off 16,000 corporate employees in push to reduce bureaucracy and fund AI
description: Amazon is cutting roughly 16,000 corporate jobs, marking its second major round of layoffs since October and extending a multiyear effort to slim down the company’s white-collar workforce. The move lands at a moment when the tech giant is pouring billions into artificial intelligence, data centers, and infrastructure, even as it tightens headcount across internal

title: Amazon cuts about 16,000 corporate jobs in latest layoffs
description: The tech giant has said it plans to use generative artificial intelligence to replace corporate workers. It has also been reducing a workforce that swelled during the pandemic.
content:
Amazon is slashing about 16,000 corporate jobs in the second round of mass layoffs for the ecommerce company in three months.
The tech giant has said it plans to use generative artificial intelligence to replace corporate workers. It has also been re... [3662 chars]

title: Pinterest lays off 15 per cent employees, AI is the reason
description: Pinterest is cutting hundreds of jobs as it shifts its focus towards artificial intelligence. The move is aimed at investing more in AI-powered products while restructuring its sales operations and reducing office space.
content: Pinterest has announced it will lay off around 15 per cent of its workforce as it is focusing heavily on artificial intelligence. The move marks the largest round of job cuts in the company’s history. The layoffs are expected to affect between 700 an... [2563 chars]

title: Saudi Arabia halts Mukaab ‘The Cube’ skyscraper project amid falling oil revenue, new AI focus
description: Saudi Arabia’s decision to suspend the Mukaab megaproject underscores a broader recalibration of Vision 2030 spending as falling oil revenues force Riyadh to prioritise faster-return sectors such as artificial intelligence, mining and logistics over capital-intensive landmark developments
content: Saudi Arabia has suspended work on the ambitious Mukaab skyscraper, one of the most high-profile elements of its Vision 2030 transformation plan, Reuters reported on Tuesday, as the kingdom reassesses spending priorities in the face of shrinking oil ... [4226 chars]

title: Strong iPhone sales to power Apple's holiday quarter, Google AI deal in focus
description: Apple anticipates its best iPhone sales in four years. Strong demand for premium Pro models is expected to fuel this growth. The company is also preparing to launch new artificial intelligence features. Investors will monitor how Apple handles a global memory chip shortage. This shortage could increase costs and impact profit margins.

title: Detroit Calling: a post-Davos message from Motor City: Ross Kerber
description: Maybe you caught the speech by BlackRock CEO Larry Fink at last week's Davos conference, coverage of which focused on his worries that capitalism has undermined itself with too much inequality, and that artificial intelligence is poised to accelerate the ​trend.

title: Can Technology Be Sustainable? Youth Delegates Discuss and Decide at MiniCOP30
description: Jaipur (Rajasthan) [India], January 28: Every new phone, laptop, or app update promises convenience and progress. But very rarely do we stop to ask where these devices come from, where they end up, and who bears the environmental and social cost of our digital habits. From rising e-waste and unsustainable mining to the growing energy footprint of Artificial Intelligence, the impact of technology today extends far beyond our screens.
